147 struct RunInfo
148 {
149  // the current testing id
150  chaos::str::UTF8String id;
151  // whether the tests should be run in a single process or not
152  bool single_proc;
153  // whether the test is being run as a sub-process of a parent testing
154  // process
155  bool sub_proc;
156  // the paths to the tests to run
157  std::set< chaos::str::UTF8String > paths;
158  // whether the standard output stream is being used
159  bool use_stdout;
160  // information for stdout
161  OutInfo stdout_info;
162  // mapping from file path to write to, to the format to use
163  std::map< chaos::str::UTF8String, OutInfo* > files;
164 
165  RunInfo()
166  :
167  single_proc( false ),
168  sub_proc ( false ),
169  use_stdout ( true ),
170  stdout_info( 3, TestLogger::OUT_PRETTY_TEXT )
171  {
172  }
173 };
174 
181 class TestCore
182 {
183 public:
184 
185  //-------------------------PUBLIC STATIC ATTRIBUTES-------------------------
186 
187  static TestLogger logger;
188  static std::map< chaos::str::UTF8String, UnitTest* > test_map;
189  static std::set< chaos::str::UTF8String > base_modules;
190  static std::set< chaos::str::UTF8String > known_modules;
191  static chaos::str::UTF8String current_module;
192 
193  //-------------------------------CONSTRUCTOR--------------------------------
194 
202  TestCore(
203  const chaos::str::UTF8String& path,
204  UnitTest* unit_test,
205  const chaos::str::UTF8String& file,
206  chaos::int32 line,
207  bool module = false,
208  RunInfo* run_info = NULL )
209  {
210  try
211  {
212  // run tests
213  if ( run_info )
214  {
215  TestCore::setup( run_info );
216  TestCore::run( run_info );
217  TestCore::teardown( run_info );
218  return;
219  }
220 
221  // module declaration
222  if ( module )
223  {
224  TestCore::declare_module( path, file, line );
225  return;
226  }
227 
228  // unit declaration
229  TestCore::declare_unit( path, unit_test, file, line );
230  }
231  catch ( chaos::test::ex::TestError& e )
232  {
233  // TODO: should this go to loggers?
234  std::cerr << e.get_message() << std::endl;
235  throw e;
236  }
237  }
238 
239 private:
240 
241  //-------------------------PRIVATE MEMBER FUNCTIONS-------------------------
242 
246  static void declare_module(
247  const chaos::str::UTF8String& path,
248  const chaos::str::UTF8String& file,
249  chaos::int32 line );
250 
254  static void declare_unit(
255  const chaos::str::UTF8String& path,
256  UnitTest* unit_test,
257  const chaos::str::UTF8String& file,
258  chaos::int32 line );

375 #define CHAOS_TEST_MODULE( path ) \
376  namespace \
377  { \
378  chaos::test::internal::TestCore t( #path, NULL, "", 0, true ); \
379  }
380 
386 #define CHAOS_TEST_UNIT( name ) \
387  CHAOS_TEST_UNIT_FIXTURE( name, chaos::test::Fixture )
388 
417 #define CHAOS_TEST_UNIT_FIXTURE( name, fixture_type ) \
418  struct name : public chaos::test::internal::UnitTest \
419  { \
420  fixture_type* fixture; \
421  name() : UnitTest( #name ), fixture( new fixture_type() ){} \
422  virtual ~name(){ delete fixture; } \
423  virtual chaos::test::Fixture* get_fixture() { return fixture; } \
424  virtual void execute(); \
425  }; \
426  static chaos::test::internal::TestCore object_##name ( \
427  #name, new name(), __FILE__, __LINE__ ); \
428  void name::execute()
429 
430 
436 #define CHAOS_CHECK_EQUAL( a, b ) \
437  if ( a == b ) \
438  { \
439  chaos::test::internal::TestCore::logger.report_check_pass( \
440  "CHAOS_CHECK_EQUAL", __FILE__, __LINE__ ); \
441  } \
442  else \
443  { \
444  chaos::str::UTF8String f_e_m; \
445  f_e_m << a << " does not equal " << b; \
446  chaos::test::internal::TestCore::logger.report_check_fail( \
447  "CHAOS_CHECK_EQUAL", __FILE__, __LINE__, f_e_m ); \
448  }

A Fixture is an object that can be used to set up a unit test environment.
